result.execSummary:
The defendant Martyna Helena Plonka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 9:13 AM Defendant Martyna Helena Plonka in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Martyna Helena Plonka.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf for Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading. State recites agreement that defendant plead to Count 3. Count 4 to be dismissed but read in. For Count 3, withheld sentence for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, pay mandatory court costs, serve 60 days jail with credit for 40 days and restitution to remain open for 30 days. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Nelsen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights she is waiving by her plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 3, withheld sentence for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, pay mandatory court costs, serve 60 days jail with credit for 40 days and restitution to remain open for 30 days. Count 4 is dismissed but read in.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
